attributes.action: Ban the sale of nuts in airports and stop them being on board aeroplanes.
attributes.additional_details: Nut allergies are one of the few airborne allergies that can be fatal. The micro particles that are in the air in confined areas such as aeroplanes and airport areas can cause anaphylaxis, often on board with limited medical help. This can be easily avoided by banning all nuts being served, eaten or brought into airports and planes. There have been many situations recently that were entirely avoidable and will increase the safety of passengers who are effected by this allergy.
attributes.background: Stop the sale of nuts in UK airports, ban them from being in food served onboard, ban them from being brought on board by passengers, ban them from being brought into airports.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petition, which calls for similar action:

Ban all peanuts and tree nuts on all flights to protect allergy sufferers
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/733137
